intro: Ceramia calathiflora, commonly known as the flame-of-India, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble a flame, composed of numerous small, tubular flowers clustered together. The plant thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Its foliage is typically dark green and glossy, providing a lush backdrop to its vibrant blooms. Ceramia calathiflora is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its striking appearance and ability to thrive in shaded to partially sunny conditions.
